ResourceHeader.Description:
GIRO provides accurate specification of the electron density in the Earth's
      ionosphere at >60 locations in the world. 37 GIRO locations provide real-time ionospheric
      data to the central server in Lowell, Massachusetts within several minutes. GIRO sites
      are equipped by Digisonde instruments that use the high frequency remote sounding
      technique to probe the bottomside ionosphere from 80 km up to the peak of ionospheric
      plasma density. Real-time and retrospective data from GIRO locations are ingested in Lowell
      Digital Ionogram DataBase (DIDBase) GIRO data are open for public access via DIDBase and
      DriftBase Web Portals, and custom software tools for digisonde data analysis, SAO Explorer
      and Drift Explorer.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement:
Heavy investments of time, effort, expertise,
      and funds continue to be made to produce, collect, quality
      control, interpret, and archive ionosonde data. It is therefore
      important that the data suppliers and Lowell GIRO Data Center
      (LGDC) are appropriately acknowledged in scientific publications
      that include analysis of data obtained from LGDC servers.

      Please read Rules of the Road
      https://giro.uml.edu/didbase/RulesOfTheRoad.html for license
      information and refer to Acknowledgements List
      https://giro.uml.edu/didbase/acknowledgements.htm to use GIRO
      data per license requirements.
